decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence by playing low-cost Spirit creatures and using disruptive elements like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage to control the opponent's plays. The deck also aims to increase its own power and toughness with cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom. Additionally, the deck utilizes Aether Vial and Collected Company to efficiently put creatures onto the battlefield. The lands in the deck provide a variety of colors to support the deck's card requirements and utilize utility lands like Moorland Haunt and Horizon Canopy.

The key concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo using Krark-Clan Ironworks (KCI) and various artifacts. The deck focuses on generating mana and card advantage through cards like Mox Opal, Terrarion, Mind Stone, and Ichor Wellspring. With the help of Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever, players can repeatedly sacrifice and recur artifacts, especially with the support of Buried Ruin and Inventors' Fair. This allows players to generate massive amounts of mana and draw cards, enabling explosive plays and potentially overwhelming opponents with Engineered Explosives and other powerful spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to rapidly increase the power and toughness of creatures. It includes cards like Walking Ballista, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager to take advantage of this effect, allowing for quick and efficient aggression. The deck also includes cards like Animation Module and Hangarback Walker to create additional synergy with the +1/+1 counters and modular abilities. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with cards like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings helping to ensure the deck can execute its game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, combined with pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth, to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. Protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing ensure that the creatures can connect with the opponent. By quickly accumulating poison counters, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish a defense. The mana base is optimized for consistent plays and includes Inkmoth Nexus as an alternate win condition.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with cards like Bridge from Below, Bloodghast, and Gravecrawler, using discard spells like Faithless Looting and Collective Brutality to enable the combo. By sacrificing creatures with Viscera Seer and other outlets, the player can trigger powerful effects from Bridge from Below and reanimate creatures like Vengevine and Bloodghast quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Walking Ballista and Goblin Bushwhacker to finish off the opponent or create explosive board states. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore to cheat out powerful threats like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix. The goal is to put pressure on opponents early and overwhelm them with fast, aggressive creatures like Bloodghast and Flameblade Adept. The deck also includes removal in the form of Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with any threats from the opponent. Overall, the strategy is to be fast and relentless, forcing opponents to react to the constant threats being thrown at them.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Krark-Clan Ironworks along with Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to generate value through sacrificing artifacts. The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces and looping artifacts to generate mana and card advantage, eventually leading to a win condition. The inclusion of various artifacts like Terrarion, Ichor Wellspring, and Pyrite Spellbomb help to fuel the combo while cards like Sai, Master Thopterist provide additional value. The mana base is optimized to support the combo and maximize efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a massive amount of mana, allowing you to cast powerful colorless threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, Wurmcoil Engine, and Walking Ballista. The deck focuses on controlling the game with cards like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Oblivion Stone, while also using cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find the UrzaTron lands quickly and efficiently. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Spirits, with cards that provide synergy and boost their power, such as Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom. It also includes disruptive elements like Spell Queller and Remorseful Cleric to control the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, using Aether Vial and Collected Company to efficiently put creatures into play. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colors and allow for consistent casting of its spells.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using efficient and low-cost burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Searing Blaze, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack. The deck aims to apply consistent pressure with fast creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also having the reach to close out the game with direct damage spells like Boros Charm and Shard Volley. The mana base is designed to support the fast pace of the deck and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive human creatures, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump them up. Cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to ensure that these creatures can hit the battlefield quickly and safely, overwhelming the opponent with a fast and powerful aggro strategy. Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage provide disruption and control elements to hinder the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure from the early turns and win through a quick and overwhelming assault.

The main idea behind this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption while gradually gaining card advantage through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. The deck also includes efficient threats like Snapcaster Mage and Bitterblossom to apply pressure on the opponent. The land base is designed to support the control game plan with utility lands like Field of Ruin and Creeping Tar Pit, while also providing consistent mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The deck aims to quickly generate a large amount of mana by casting cheap spells and reducing their cost with cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer. This allows for explosive turns where the player can cast multiple spells in a single turn, eventually leading to either Empty the Warrens or Grapeshot to finish off the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes card selection and draw spells to find the necessary pieces for the combo, ensuring consistency in executing the win condition.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to play Primeval Titan and Scapeshift in order to combo off with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. It aims to get multiple Mountains into play to trigger Valakut's ability and deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck includes cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow to accelerate the mana base, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to handle opposing threats.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards such as Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp. By continuously dredging with cards like Life from the Loam and Shriekhorn, the deck can easily bring back multiple creatures from the graveyard at once, triggering powerful effects like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and direct damage, creating a difficult board state to deal with.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Human creature type to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards such as Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to grow creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on. Cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch help accelerate the deck's game plan and ensure a continuous stream of threats. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall the opponent's threats while gradually generating card advantage and eventually resolving powerful spells like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Sphinx's Revelation to take over the game. The deck also has versatile removal options with Lightning Bolt, Path to Exile, and Supreme Verdict, allowing it to deal with a wide range of threats. The win condition usually comes from using Celestial Colonnade as a threat while controlling the board and outvaluing the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disruption spells to control the pace of the game. Utilizing a mix of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. With a strong mana base and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, the deck has the ability to grind out wins against a variety of opponents. The inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and Kolaghan's Command provide additional utility and flexibility in different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers such as Teferi and Jace. It aims to efficiently handle threats with cards like Terminus and Path to Exile, while using card advantage from draw spells like Serum Visions and Cryptic Command. The win condition is often through Celestial Colonnade or slow grinding with Teferi. The deck also includes disruption with Field of Ruin and Ghost Quarter, making it difficult for opponents to establish their game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful, hexproof creature by stacking it with auras that enhance its abilities. With cards like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle providing an evasive threat, combined with a variety of auras like Ethereal Armor and Daybreak Coronet to pump up the creature's power and toughness, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive, hexproof threat that is difficult to deal with. The inclusion of cards like Path to Exile and Dromoka's Command also provide some removal and interaction to deal with opposing threats.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful spirit creatures that can quickly take control of the battlefield. By using cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial, the deck is able to quickly deploy its threats and apply pressure early in the game. Cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain provide additional buffs to the spirit creatures, making them even more difficult to deal with. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Spell Queller and Path to Exile to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with cards and then bring back key creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast to overwhelm the opponent. This is achieved through cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Cathartic Reunion to dredge cards into the graveyard quickly. Creeping Chill provides additional reach with its life drain effect, while Conflagrate can be used as a finisher. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and quickly close out the game with its powerful graveyard recursion abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Vengevine and Bloodghast. Once you have a critical mass of creatures in the graveyard, you can combo off with cards like Bridge from Below and Greater Gargadon to overwhelm your opponent with a flood of creatures. The deck is fast-paced and aggressive, aiming to win the game before the opponent has a chance to set up their defenses.

The deck focuses on using Hardened Scales to amplify the effects of +1/+1 counters, allowing for powerful synergies with creatures like Steel Overseer, Walking Ballista, and Hangarback Walker. Utilizing Arcbound Ravager and Animation Module along with counters from Throne of Geth, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with large creatures and resilient board presence. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle with Inkmoth Nexus for infect damage potential. The inclusion of cards like Welding Jar and Dismember adds versatility and protection to ensure the deck's threats remain resilient.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also putting pressure on the board with aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board, and uses cards like Faithless Looting to filter through the deck and utilize graveyard synergies, such as bringing back Arclight Phoenix. Overall, this deck is designed to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game.
